alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 04 at 10:07AM CDT until April 05 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Big Muddy River near Murphysboro. .The Big Muddy River at Murphysboro is expected to rise briefly to flood stage by this evening. Backwater from the Mississippi River is helping to keep water levels on the Big Muddy River elevated. Once the flood wave on the Mississippi River moves past the Big Muddy River on Tuesday, water levels should once again fall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Muddy River near Murphysboro. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 22.0 feet and remain nearly steady through the night. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
